description: Malaria is a life-threatening disease caused by parasites transmitted through infected mosquito bites.

treatment.prevention: Mosquito nets, insect repellent, antimalarial drugs

description: Tuberculosis (TB) is a contagious bacterial infection that primarily affects the lungs.

treatment.medications: Combination of antibiotics (isoniazid, rifampin, ethambutol, pyrazinamide)
treatment.prevention: BCG vaccination, screening, treating latent TB

description: The common cold is a viral infection of the upper respiratory tract, mostly caused by rhinoviruses.

treatment.medications: Over-the-counter pain relievers, decongestants, cough suppressants
treatment.supportive_care: Rest, hydration, gargling with salt water
treatment.prevention: Frequent handwashing, avoiding close contact with sick individuals

symptoms: Severe coughing fits with a 'whooping' sound
description: Whooping cough is a highly contagious respiratory infection caused by Bordetella pertussis.

treatment.medications: Antibiotics such as azithromycin or clarithromycin

description: Cholera is an acute diarrheal infection caused by consuming food or water contaminated with Vibrio cholerae bacteria.

treatment.medications: Oral rehydration salts (ORS), antibiotics (in severe cases)
treatment.prevention: Safe water and sanitation, cholera vaccination

description: Influenza (Flu) is a viral infection that affects the respiratory system, causing a range of symptoms.
HIV is a virus that weakens the immune system, leading to AIDS if untreated.

treatment.prevention: Safe sex practices, HIV testing, ART for prevention

description: Dengue is a mosquito-borne viral disease causing flu-like symptoms and severe joint pain.

treatment.medications: Pain relievers (acetaminophen), no aspirin or NSAIDs
treatment.prevention: Avoid mosquito bites, dengue vaccination in high-risk areas

description: Typhoid fever is caused by Salmonella typhi bacteria, typically through contaminated food or water.

symptoms: Small white spots in the mouth
description: Measles is a highly contagious viral infection that primarily affects children.
